intro: Alexitoxicon raddeanum, commonly known as the sorrowful bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or woodland settings. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies for digestive and respiratory ailments.
